Recommendation: Avoid routine use in those with chronic kidney disease stage 3a or higher

Risk Rationale: Increased risk of severe sedation-related adverse events, including respiratory depression and death
Recommendation: Avoid; exceptions are when transitioning from opioid therapy to gabapentin or pregabalin, or when using gabapentinoids to reduce opioid dose, although caution should be used in all circumstances.
Avoid; minimize number of anticholinergic drugs

Risk Rationale: Increased risk of falls (all) and of fracture (benzodiazepines and nonbenzodiazepine, benzodiazepine receptor agonist hypnotics)
Recommendation: Avoid total of three or more CNS-active drugs; minimize number of CNS-active drugs

Risk Rationale: Increased risk of peptic ulcer disease or gastrointestinal bleeding
Recommendation: Avoid; if not possible, provide gastrointestinal protection

Risk Rationale: Increased risk of urinary incontinence in older women
Recommendation: Avoid in older women, unless conditions warrant both drugs
Avoid when possible; if used together, monitor INR closely
